roleset.name: auxiliary
roleset.note: DO-V NOTES: based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus (from do.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: DO NOT TAG AUXILIARIES
example.text: What flights do you have from Milwaukee to Tampa?

example.name: another auxiliary
example.text: The US is one of the few industrialized nations that doesn't have a high standard of regulation for asbestos.

roleset.name: act

alias.framenet: Intentionally_act Intentionally_affect Ingest_substance Successful_action Take_place_of Resolve_problem

roleset.note: DO-V NOTES: based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus (from do.02-v predicate notes)
DOING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, do.02. No VNcls. (from doing.01-n)

example.name: do-v
example.text: In this department we are doing fine this fall.

example.name: do-v
example.text: do-v: Seymour Cray can do it again.

example.name: do-v: with benefactive
example.text: Congress will do stupid things with the Tax Code.

example.name: do-v: with instrument
example.text: Anyone buying the stock now must do so *trace* using some guesswork.

example.name: doing-n: args 0 and 1
example.text: From him, we could expect nothing other than his doing the "right thing," as we should expect from all our elected officials.

roleset.name: have some association with
roleset.note: DO-V NOTES: This roleset was redone by Claire. The roles may seem a little unusual (seems like args 1 and 2 should be swapped) because the previous roleset was not adequate, but we wanted the new roleset to maintain as much of previous annotation as possible. (from do.04-v)

role.descr: thing with which something has to do, "with..." phrase

example.name: do-v: supercritical
example.text: [Mary 's supercritical attitude toward Byron]-2 had nothing [0]-1 [*-2] to do [*T*-1] with his moral disrepute .

example.name: do-v: something is better than nothing
example.text: These issues have something WHNP-1 *PRO* to do *T*-1 with traffic and transportation.

roleset.name: serve time (usually a sentence but could be an appointment)
roleset.note: DO-V, DOING-N NOTES: Added by Julia for AMR.

example.name: do-v
example.text: If people commit the crime people-1 should be willing *PRO*-1 to do the time and the people who can afford it, should pay for it surely?

roleset.name: suffice
roleset.note: DO-V NOTES: Added by Julia for AMR.

example.name: do-v
example.text: If the history of the Shinto shrines in HI from the Shinto shrines will do, including the lawsuit they filed and won to get the property back after the war...
example.arg: the history of the Shinto shrines in HI from the Shinto shrines

example.name: do-v
example.text: Mermaids Just Won't Do As Tattoos .

example.name: do_in-v: passive
example.text: I-1 don't feel down or done *-1 in because I show British serials on my television network or read their books.

example.name: do_in-v: active with causal arg0
example.text: The marathon did me in.

example.name: do_in-v: active with animate agentive arg0
example.text: Former Rajan gangster's own men did him in, say cops

example.name: do_away-v: automatically generated
example.text: [Things like that]-1 would increase rather than be done away with [*-1].

roleset.name: nominal version of light verb
roleset.note: DOING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on making.02. (from doing.02-n)

roles.note: This roleset should only be used for cases where 'doing' acts as a light verb and the object of 'doing' is also an eventive, predicating noun. Use argMs for all other arguments-- these cannot be predicted because they are related to the true predicate rather than 'doing'. (from doing.02-n)

role.descr: maker, subject of the light-verbish noun

example.name: doing-n: both args, standard construction
example.text: his plans to attend counseling sessions in Minot would be insufficient to meet his needs and to prevent his doing harm to others.

example.name: doing-n: adjectival construction
example.text: Accusations of unjust harm doing by the ingroup threaten the group's moral identity.

roleset.name: be completed; bring to completion
roleset.note: DONE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, do-v.02, begin-v.01. (from done.01-j)

roles.note: arg1 should NOT be an S-node. (from done.01-j)

role.descr: person that brought arg1 to completion (mere agents of arg1 should just be within arg1)
activity completed, event that has stopped

example.name: done-j: agentless
example.text: When-1 they-2 're done *PRO*-2 campaigning against motherhood *-1 , maybe the GOP will launch an attack on apple pie .

example.name: done-j
example.text: I am done with my math homework

example.name: done-j: arg1 subject
example.text: My homework is done.

example.name: done-j: arg0 subject, intransitive
example.text: We're all done now.

roleset.name: set phrase: done for, doomed
roleset.note: DO-V NOTES: Based on Bolt data. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from do.06-v)
DONE_FOR-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-6. (from done.03-j)

example.name: done_for-j: concatenate 'for' with the rel
example.text: [You-1] are [*-1]done for!

example.name: done_for-j: arg1
example.text: If not for Hong Kong , you would all be done for ' " .

roleset.name: able to be done/accomplished
roleset.note: DOABLE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on SMS. Relation to do.02 (from doable.01-j)

example.name: doable-j: arg1
example.text: Yeah that s def doable .
